title: Hello World
description: Write a program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the console.

title: Sum of Two Numbers
description: Write a function that takes two numbers as input and returns their sum.

starterCode.python:
def add_numbers(a, b):
    return a + b

line = input().strip().split()
a = int(line[0])
b = int(line[1])
print(add_numbers(a, b))
starterCode.lua:
local a, b = io.read("*n", "*n")
print(a + b)
starterCode.r:
input <- file('stdin', 'r')
line <- readLines(input, n=1)
parts <- as.numeric(strsplit(line, " ")[[1]])
cat(parts[1] + parts[2], "\n")
starterCode.ruby:
a, b = gets.split.map(&:to_i)
puts a + b

title: Even or Odd
description: Write a program that determines if a number is even or odd.

starterCode.lua:
local num = io.read("*n")
if num % 2 == 0 then
    print("Even")
else
    print("Odd")
end

title: Factorial
description: Write a function to calculate the factorial of a number.

starterCode.ruby:
def factorial(n)
  return 1 if n <= 1
  n * factorial(n - 1)
end

n = gets.to_i
puts factorial(n)
starterCode.php:
<?php
function factorial($n) {
    if ($n <= 1) return 1;
    return $n * factorial($n - 1);
}

fscanf(STDIN, "%d", $n);
echo factorial($n);
?>

title: Reverse String
description: Write a program that reverses a given string.

starterCode.r:
input <- file('stdin', 'r')
line <- readLines(input, n=1)
cat(paste(rev(strsplit(line, NULL)[[1]]), collapse=""), "\n")

title: Find Maximum
description: Write a function that finds the maximum value in a list of numbers.

starterCode.lua:
local line = io.read("*l")
local maxVal = nil
for num in line:gmatch("%S+") do
    num = tonumber(num)
    if maxVal == nil or num > maxVal then
        maxVal = num
    end
end
print(maxVal)
starterCode.r:
input <- file('stdin', 'r')
line <- readLines(input, n=1)
numbers <- as.numeric(strsplit(line, " ")[[1]])
cat(max(numbers), "\n")
starterCode.php:
<?php
$line = fgets(STDIN);
$numbers = array_map('intval', explode(' ', trim($line)));
echo max($numbers);
?>

title: Palindrome Check
description: Write a program that checks if a string is a palindrome.

starterCode.lua:
local text = io.read("*l"):lower()
if text == string.reverse(text) then
    print("Palindrome")
else
    print("Not Palindrome")
end
starterCode.ruby:
text = gets.chomp.downcase
puts text == text.reverse ? "Palindrome" : "Not Palindrome"

title: Fibonacci Sequence
description: Write a function that returns the nth Fibonacci number.

starterCode.lua:
function fibonacci(n)
    if n <= 1 then return n end
    local a, b = 0, 1
    for i = 2, n do
        a, b = b, a + b
    end
    return b
end

local n = io.read("*n")
print(fibonacci(n))
starterCode.ruby:
def fibonacci(n)
  return n if n <= 1
  a, b = 0, 1
  (2..n).each { a, b = b, a + b }
  b
end

n = gets.to_i
puts fibonacci(n)
starterCode.php:
<?php
function fibonacci($n) {
    if ($n <= 1) return $n;
    $a = 0; $b = 1;
    for ($i = 2; $i <= $n; $i++) {
        $temp = $a + $b;
        $a = $b;
        $b = $temp;
    }
    return $b;
}

fscanf(STDIN, "%d", $n);
echo fibonacci($n);
?>

title: Prime Check
description: Write a program that checks if a number is prime.

starterCode.lua:
function isPrime(n)
    if n < 2 then return false end
    for i = 2, math.sqrt(n) do
        if n % i == 0 then return false end
    end
    return true
end

local n = io.read("*n")
if isPrime(n) then
    print("Prime")
else
    print("Not Prime")
end
starterCode.ruby:
require 'prime'
n = gets.to_i
puts Prime.prime?(n) ? "Prime" : "Not Prime"
starterCode.php:
<?php
function isPrime($n) {
    if ($n < 2) return false;
    for ($i = 2; $i <= sqrt($n); $i++) {
        if ($n % $i == 0) return false;
    }
    return true;
}

fscanf(STDIN, "%d", $n);
echo isPrime($n) ? "Prime" : "Not Prime";
?>

title: String Length
description: Write a program that counts the length of a string without using len().

starterCode.python:
text = input()
count = 0
for char in text:
    count += 1
print(count)
starterCode.lua:
local text = io.read("*l")
local count = 0
for i = 1, #text do
    count = count + 1
end
print(count)
starterCode.r:
input <- file('stdin', 'r')
line <- readLines(input, n=1)
cat(nchar(line), "\n")
